member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.RemoveRestrictions(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Remove all resttrictions from a pdf file
member.param: The full path to the restricted pdf file
If True, the original restricted pdf will be saved as [filename]_BAK.pdf. Else, it will be overwritten.
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded. False otherwise

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.ExtractPdfPage(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Extract a single page from source pdf to a new pdf
member.param: the full path to source pdf file
the page number to extract
the full path for the output pdf

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.ExtractPdfPage(System.String,System.Int32[],System.String)
member.summary: Extract selected pages from a source pdf to a new pdf
member.param: the full path to source pdf to a new pdf
the page numbers to extract (i.e {1, 3, 5, 6})
The full path for the output pdf
member.remarks: The output pdf will contains the extracted pages in the order of the page numbers listed in pageNumbersToExtract parameter.

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.ExtractPdfPages(System.String,System.Int32[],System.String)
member.summary: Extract pages from an existing pdf file to create a new pdf with bookmarks preserved
member.param: full path to sthe source pdf
an integer array containing the page number of the pages to be extracted
the full path to the output pdf

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.SplitPdfByParts(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Split a single pdf file into multiple pdfs with equal number of pages.
member.param: the full path to the source pdf
the number of splitted pdfs to split to
the base file name (full path) for splitted pdfs. The actual output pdf file names will be serialized.
member.remarks: The last splitted pdf may not have the same number of pages as the rest, depending on the combination of number of pages in the source pdf and the number of parts to be splitted. For example, if the original pdf has 9 pages and it is to be splitted into 5 parts, the last splitted pdf will have only 1 page while all others have 2 pages.

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.SplitPdfByPages(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Split source pdf into multiple pdfs with specifc number of pages
member.param: the full path to source pdf
the number of pages each splitted pdf should contain
the base file name (full path) for splitted pdfs. The actual output pdf file names will be serialized.
member.remarks: The last splitted pdf may not have the same number of pages as the rest, depending on the combination of number of pages in the source pdf and the number of target pages in each splitted pdf. For example, if the original pdf has 9 pages and it is to be splitted with 2 pages for each pdf, the last splitted pdf will have only 1 page while all others have 2 pages.

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.ExtractAndMergePdfPages(System.Data.DataTable,System.String)
member.summary: Extract pages from multiple pdf's file and merge them into a single pdf
member.param: the datatable containing source pfd paths and the pages to extract from each of them. This datatable should have 2 datacolumns of type String. The 1st column (column 0) is for the file (full) path while the 2nd column (column 1) is for the list of pages to extract from the source pdf in column 1. This list is a string of integer values separated by commas (ex: "1, 3, 2, 5 , 8, 7, 9")
the path to save the output pdf
member.remarks: the pdf pages are extracted and merged in the order listed in the source datatable. That is, for source pdf files, they will be merged from top row down, and for pages, they will be merged by the order listed in the csv string

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.ConvertToIntegerArray(System.String)
member.summary: Helper function to convert a csv integer string to an integer array
member.param: the integer string in csv format (ex: "1, 5, 7, 4")
member.returns: Integer array converted from the csv string (ex: {1, 5, 7, 4}
member.remarks: No error checking/handling. If the input string contains non-numeric values the function will crash. It's up to you to handle this error.

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.AddWatermarkImage(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add and image as the watermark on each page of the source pdf to create a new pdf with watermark
member.param: the full path to the source pdf
the full path where the watermarked pdf will be saved to
the full path to the image file to use as the watermark
member.remarks: The watermark image will be align in the center of each page

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.AddWatermarkText(System.String,System.String,System.String[],iTextSharp.text.pdf.BaseFont,System.Single,iTextSharp.text.BaseColor,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Add text as the watermark to each page of the source pdf to create a new pdf with text watermark
member.param: the full path to the source pdf file
the full path where the watermarked pdf file will be saved to
the string array conntaining the text to use as the watermark. Each element is treated as a line in the watermark
the font to use for the watermark. The default font is HELVETICA
the size of the font. The default size is 48
the color of the watermark. The default color is blue
the opacity of the watermark. The default opacity is 0.3
the rotation in degree of the watermark. The default rotation is 45 degree

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.MergePdfFilesWithBookmarks(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Merge multiple pdf files into 1 preserving all bookmarks
member.param: string array containing full path to the source pdf's
full path to the output (merged) pdf

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.MergePdfFiles(System.String[],System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Merge multiple pdf files into a single pdf
member.param: string array containing full paths to the pdf files to be merged
full path to the merged output pdf
Author's name.
Creator's name
Subject field
Title field
keywords field
member.returns: True if the merging is successful, False otherwise.
member.remarks: All optional paramters are used for the output pdf metadata. You can see a pdf metada by going to the PDF tab of the file's Property window.

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.ExtractURLs(System.String,System.Int32[])
member.summary: This function extract the hyperlinks found on a pdf files.
member.param: the full path to the source pdf file
An Integer array containing the page numbers from which the the URLs will be extracted. The default value is Nothing, and it will extract URLs from the whole document.
member.returns: A datatable containing the URLs and page numbers where they are found
member.remarks: This function still need more work to extract URLs from Anchor objects or from PRIndirectReference objects. I'll will update the code once I found a way to do so

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.FillAcroForm(System.String,System.Data.DataRow,System.String)
member.summary: Fill in an AcroForm
member.param: the full path to the pdf form file
a datarow where the column names are the field names in the pdf, and the value for that field is the value of the cell in that column
the full path of the output file

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.ReplacePagesWithBlank(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Replace specified page(s) in a pdf file with a blank page
member.param: The source pdf file to have pages replaced
List of pages in source pdf to be replaced with blank page
The output pdf with pages replaced by blank pages
Optional template pdf to used as replacement page
member.returns: True if successful, False if failed
member.remarks: If the template pdf parameter is left blank, a blank template pdf will be created on the fly and deleted when done

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.InsertPages(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int32,iTextSharp.text.pdf.PdfImportedPage},System.String)
member.summary: Insert new pages to an existing pdf file
member.param: The full path to the source pdf
The dictionary contains the pages to be inserted in the source pdf. The key is the page number to be inserted. The value is the PdfImportedPage to insert
The full path of the resulting output pdf file
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded. False otherwise.
member.remarks: To create the pagesToInsert dictionary, you can use the iTextSharp.text.pdf.PdfCopy class to open an existing pdf file and call the GetImportedPage method

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.RemovePages(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Remove specified page(s) from a pdf file
member.param: The source pdf to have pages removed from
List of pages to be removed
The output pdf after pages removed
member.returns: True if successful, false if failed

member.name: M:ByAPdf.PdfManipulation2.AddImageToPage(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Size,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Add an image to pdf pages
member.param: The full path to the source pdf file
The full path to the image file to use
The full path to be used for the output pdf file
The lower left corner location where the image will be placed on a pdf page
The size of the image on pdf page
The pages where the image should be added. Default option is Nothing which will add the image to all pages on the pdf file
member.remarks: Units for location and size are in points. 1 inch = 72 points
